description.narrative: UNDP in Guyana is providing assistance to the Government of Guyana to prepare a GEF Project Document for a medium-sized project (MSP) entitled “Mainstreaming biodiversity management into mining concession framework and practices in Guyana”.
Final Global Environment Facility (GEF) Medium Sized Project ( MSP) Project Document Mainstreaming Biodiversity Management into Mining Concession Framework and Practices in Guyana
Energy - policy, planning and administration

i. Number of actions taken by (such as issuance of enforcement notices, laying of charges or mediation proceedings) in the areas identified through the project as high priority for monitoring and enforcement in small and medium-scale gold mining areas 2. level of coordinating capacity among institutions and non-state actors for enforcement of mining-related environmental practices 3. percentage of total areas identified as high priority for monitoring and enforcement that is being monitored using satellite tracking.

comment.narrative: Number of enforcement and prohibition policies has almost nil effect for small and medium scale mining. Ad-hoc monitoring or compliance checks in response to complaints amount to approximately 4-5 per year

i. Increase in number of compliance actions taken by EPA (such as issuance of enforcement notices, laying of charges or mediation proceedings) by at least 50% over 2013/2014 baseline target of at least 7 per year) 2. At least 75% of total high priority area is being being monitored using satellite tracking.
2. Over 25 persons trained in satellite image interpretation. Laboratory equipment for the Mining School was ordered from an overseas supplier.

title.narrative: Support to the alignment of NAP for Land Degradation

description.narrative: PIMS # 5597 SUPPORT THE ALIGNMENT OF THE NATIONAL ACTION PLAN (NAP) FOR LAND DEGRADATION WITH THE UNCCD'S 10 YEAR STRATEGY

title.narrative: NAP Alignment 2015 AWP Signed Word Version
NAP Alignment 2015 AWP Signed Atlas Version
SUPPORT THE ALIGNMENT OF NAP F

description.narrative: The Project objective is to reduce land degradation by; enabling wide groups of stakeholders to impart and share knowledge and experiences on sustainable land management
Energy - policy, planning and administration

Aligned NAP i. Analytical Reports prepared on Policy and Planning Tools ii.Priorities identified and Awareness increased on NAP Alignment iii. Training of Stakeholders on the use of indicators for NAP Alignment and implementation completed. iv. Baseline data collected for the NAP Alignment

comment.narrative: No aligned National Action Plan (NAP)

(i) policies to support an aligned NAP to combat land degradation assessed; the planning tool 'performance report of the assessment of implementation strategy (PRAIS) assessed'; awareness of NAP raised through two more public awareness sessions. (ii) human capacity for NAP alignment strengthened through creation of a national editorial working group on NAP alignment. Scientific capacity for NAP alignment strengthened through through training sessions for 13 Natural Resources Agencies on use of PRAIS and financing for technology framework for NAP implementation. (iii) the policy has been strengthened through recommendation to the Guyana Lands and survey Commission to harmonise existing policies and plans in land administration and management. The institutional framework for NAP alignment and implementation 'Aligned National Action Plan to Combat Land Degradation' produced. (iv) finance and technology framework for NAP implementation created (v) human and scientific capacity for implementation of implementation of indicator-based monitoring and assessment strengthened through training for 13 Natural Resources Agencies in use and interpretation of land management date and indicators used in the national reports to the United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification (UNCCD). (vi) Report for the second leg of the review process "Compendium of Best Practices in Combating Land Degradation' prepared for the UNCCD. Baseline data has been collected for NAP alignment and is contained within the report 'National Rapid Stocktaking Report'.

description.narrative: To undertake a Mercury Initial Assessment to enable the Government to determine the national requirements and needs for the ratification of the Minamata Convention.

title.narrative: MIA EA 2015 AWP Word and Atlas Versions signed

description.narrative: To undertake a Mercury Initial Assessment to enable the Government to determine the national requirements and needs for the ratification of the Minamata Convention.
Energy - policy, planning and administration

-A national decision-making structure on mercury (“Mercury Coordination/Consultation Mechanism (MCM)”) established - Assessment Report finalized. -Awareness on the health effects of mercury increased among decision makers, the general public and population groups at risk. -Socio-economic study on the effects of mercury and alternatives in ASGM -National technical experts (national technical experts and Mercury Focus Group members) trained on data collection methodologies, reliability, and credibility and data analysis. -Mercury profile prepared. -National MIA Report in the process of preparation. -A training is carried out for a project coordinator

comment.narrative: -A Mercury Action Group has been established to improve coordination on issues related to mercury at the National Level -The documents “Inventory of Mercury releases in Guyana (level 1)” and the “Guyana Action Plan on Mercury (2015-2020)” have to some extent reviewed the policy and regulatory framework and institutional capacity and can be used as a departure point. -Some awareness among decision makers was created as a result of the Mercury work undertaken within the scope of the UNDP/UNEP mainstreaming project. -Under an agreement with WWF, another Consultant has been hired to develop a National Action Plan for mercury and concomitantly update the existing Code of Practice for the Mining Sector -There are some technical experts in Guyana (University of Guyana) who have quite extensive experience in the area of mercury and mercury inventories. -The documents “Inventory of Mercury releases in Guyana (level 1)” and the “Guyana Action Plan on Mercury (2015-2020)” contain some baseline information and can be used as a starting point. -

-Institutional capacities amongst key stakeholders built. -Institutional capacities, and the policy and regulatory framework in place to management Mercury, assessed, gaps and needs identified. -Barriers that would hinder implementation of the Convention identified. -Assessment reviewed and discussed by Mercury Focus Group. -Awareness raising plan finalized. -Public awareness raising campaign organized on the health and environmental effects of mercury and how to manage mercury containing wastes properly. -Awareness raised among decisions makers and population groups at risk. -Preventive programmes on occupational exposure implemented. -Alternatives in ASGM and the relevant sectors that were identified in the inventory -National technical experts trained to be able to undertake the Mercury Inventory. -Mercury Focus Group members trained to be able to review the Mercury Inventory. -Methodology and work programme submitted and approved by the project board. -Mercury Inventory (Level 2) completed, incl.:-Overview of emission and releases sources;-Inventory of wastes (stockpiles and generation rates);-Assessment of current practices to manage mercury;-Identification of main risk groups -MIA Report in preparation, containing:- Institutional structures available to implement the Convention.;Barriers for implementation of the Convention.; Summary of Mercury Profile.; Identification of technical and financial needs for implementation of the Convention. ;Inventory of wastes (stockpiles and generation rates);Proposal for action.; recommendations for policy and regulatory revisions. -Ensuring sound communication with international and local consultants, and assuring to bring their activity results based on the timeframe indicated in AWP.
Consultants hired and implementation of activities started.

description.narrative: This project promotes social cohesion, elections preparedness and violence prevention pre and post elections. It includes expanding work with key civil society and private sector leaders; and support to the country’s election management body, GECOM.

(i) Dialogues on social cohesion for private sector, civil society, faith based organizations, women’s groups, the differently abled implemented
(ii) Work plan for Ministry of Social Cohesion developed and adopted
i. Multi Stakeholder Forums aided in the sensitization of the Guyanese society to their own roles in helping to counter ethno-racial polarisation as the country headed to the elections.
